Cloud Controller Manager

The Cloud Controller Manager (CCM) is a Kubernetes control plane component that enables integration with cloud-specific infrastructure. It allows Kubernetes to interact with your cloud providerâ€™s APIs to provision and manage resources such as load balancers, block storage, and network routes.

Before the CCM existed, cloud provider logic was bundled into the core Kubernetes binaries. The CCM separates this logic, allowing cloud vendors to evolve independently and integrate Kubernetes in a more modular and scalable manner.
